result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deshawn S Coleman Sr

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim C.D.C (person, property, residence or family). Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

11:53 AM Defendant Deshawn S Coleman Sr in court.  Attorney Barry J Braatz in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Deshawn S Coleman Sr. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  The State is not prepared to proceed to trial next week.  The named victim cannot be served.  The State is requesting an adj.  Defense is objecting to an adjournment and moves for dismissal.  If the adjournment is not granted, defense would ask for the cash bond to be converted to a signature bond.  BTC: State's request for an adjournment granted.  Cash bond converted to a signature bond.

8:46 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Deshawn S Coleman Sr in court.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Deshawn S Coleman Sr. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard. Deft. will continue with atty Dolan.  Defense asks for a speedy trial.All Motions in Limine, Witness lists, Proposed Jury Instructions and changes to the Substantive Jury Instructions are due 48  hours before the Final Pretrial.  Parties are to check for witness availability for this scheduled trial date and inform the Court of any problems. June 10 is the drop dead date for any motions requiring any suppression hearings.

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim C.D.C (person, property, residence or family). Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:46 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly Larsen appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Deshawn S Coleman Sr appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Gregory A Holdahl appeared by video for Deshawn S Coleman Sr. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 2, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Initial appearance on February 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
